cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET.
G.T.5795
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 26th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
I. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
There is nothing to report.
French Front.
On the ARGONNE Battle Front the Americans are reported to have reached DANNEVOUX. S. of the BOIS DE SEPTSARGES - S. of MONT FAUCON - N. of EPINONVILLE - ECLISFONTAINE - BAULNY - BINARVIILE.
The French have reached SERVON - CERNAY - ROUVROY - RIPONT - are across the Railway E. of SOMME - PY and are on the line of the River PY to ST. SOUPLET.
II. ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
III. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
The Anglo-Greek forces continue their advance into Bulgaria and are advancing up the steep BELACHISTSA range, where the Greeks are near the crest north of Lake DOIRAN, and in the centre we have reached DZUMAA OBASI.
The Serbians have occupied VELES and STIP. The French are approaching KRUSEVO and the Italians have captured KRIVOCASTANI. French cavalry are advancing along the road to USKUB.
Large captures of stores continue.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
26th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.30 p.m.
